alert.note: Alert for Williams (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS NorthernIndiana (Northern Indiana and Northeastern Ohio)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 13 at 9:11PM EDT until June 13 at 10:00PM EDT by NWS NorthernIndiana
info.description: The National Weather Service in Northern Indiana has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southern Hillsdale County in southeastern Michigan... Williams County in northwestern Ohio... * Until 1000 PM EDT. * At 911 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Fremont, or 8 miles northeast of Angola, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and half dollar size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. * Locations impacted include... Montpelier, Hudson, West Unity, Pioneer, Reading, Edon, Holiday City, Columbia, West Jefferson, Cambria, Pittsford, Ransom, Waldron, Camden, Montgomery, Prattville, Alvordton, Bridgewater Center, Frontier and Nettle Lake. This includes Interstate 80 in Ohio between mile markers 0 and 22. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.25 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: Remain alert for a possible tornado! Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. If you spot a tornado go at once into the basement or small central room in a sturdy structure. Prepare immediately for large hail and damaging winds. People outside should move immediately to shelter inside a strong building. Stay away from windows.
